inputs.break_ratio_policy: ratio_lo defaults to 1/ratio_hi (symmetric inverse) unless overridden
inputs.forbid_mask_scope_note: v19 applies forbid mask ONLY when entry_mode == 'bb'

strategy_suite.always_semantics_note: For true constant-leverage hold, use --max_hold_days=0. Default >0 forces periodic exit/reentry.

audit.hold_days_semantics: entry day sets hold_days=0; increments by 1 each subsequent row while in position
audit.same_day_reentry: not allowed; exit day is always flat
audit.interest_semantics: row-based accrual while in position; includes the first row after entry (may be interpreted as entry-day accrual depending on timing assumption)
audit.end_of_data_policy: if open position exists at end, force-close and record trade with exit_reason=end_of_data
audit.lever_leg_pnl_semantics: gross PnL for leverage leg (proceeds - principal); net_after_costs = lever_leg_pnl - interest_paid - cost_paid
audit.slippage_model: cash penalty = notional * slip_rate per side; slip_rate = slip_bps * 1e-4

segmentation.notes: Each segment equity is normalized to 1.0 at its own start (base_shares=1/segment_first_price). Segment results are NOT chainable into a single continuous equity curve.

audit.forbid_mask_semantics: for each break idx b: forbid entry i in [b-contam_horizon, b+z_clear_days-1]
audit.forbid_mask_scope_note: v19 applies forbid mask ONLY when entry_mode == 'bb'

notes: Segments are normalized independently (equity starts at 1.0 in each segment).

segmentation.compute_cost_note: Per strategy: full + pre + post backtests (3x). Not optimized in v19.

interpretation.NO_GO: All three post conditions met: stop / do not deploy / do not tune further.
interpretation.GO_OR_REVIEW: Stop rule NOT triggered. This is NOT a PASS. It only means the specific immediate stop rule did not fire.

reasons: all 3 post conditions met => stop / do not deploy

audit.hold_days_semantics: entry day sets hold_days=0; increments by 1 each subsequent row while in position
audit.same_day_reentry: not allowed; exit day is always flat
audit.interest_semantics: row-based accrual while in position; includes the first row after entry (may be interpreted as entry-day accrual depending on timing assumption)
audit.end_of_data_policy: if open position exists at end, force-close and record trade with exit_reason=end_of_data
audit.lever_leg_pnl_semantics: gross PnL for leverage leg (proceeds - principal); net_after_costs = lever_leg_pnl - interest_paid - cost_paid
audit.slippage_model: cash penalty = notional * slip_rate per side; slip_rate = slip_bps * 1e-4
audit.forbid_mask_semantics: for each break idx b: forbid entry i in [b-contam_horizon, b+z_clear_days-1]
audit.forbid_mask_scope_note: v19 applies forbid mask ONLY when entry_mode == 'bb'

audit.hold_days_semantics: entry day sets hold_days=0; increments by 1 each subsequent row while in position
audit.same_day_reentry: not allowed; exit day is always flat
audit.interest_semantics: row-based accrual while in position; includes the first row after entry (may be interpreted as entry-day accrual depending on timing assumption)
audit.end_of_data_policy: if open position exists at end, force-close and record trade with exit_reason=end_of_data
audit.lever_leg_pnl_semantics: gross PnL for leverage leg (proceeds - principal); net_after_costs = lever_leg_pnl - interest_paid - cost_paid
audit.slippage_model: cash penalty = notional * slip_rate per side; slip_rate = slip_bps * 1e-4
audit.forbid_mask_semantics: for each break idx b: forbid entry i in [b-contam_horizon, b+z_clear_days-1]
audit.forbid_mask_scope_note: v19 applies forbid mask ONLY when entry_mode == 'bb'

notes: Segments are normalized independently (equity starts at 1.0 in each segment).
Compare block is a summary delta, not a continuous equity backtest across split.

segmentation.compute_cost_note: Per strategy: full + pre + post backtests (3x). Not optimized in v19.

interpretation.NO_GO: All three post conditions met: stop / do not deploy / do not tune further.
interpretation.GO_OR_REVIEW: Stop rule NOT triggered. This is NOT a PASS. It only means the specific immediate stop rule did not fire.

compare.ranking_policy: prefer post (calmar desc, sharpe0 desc) when post_ok=true; else fallback to full

notes: All strategies share the same cost/interest model (fee/tax/slippage/borrow_apr).
Turnover_proxy is state-change frequency, not dollar turnover.
Post Go/No-Go: GO_OR_REVIEW is NOT a pass; it only means the stop rule did not trigger.
